slides.title: What is Version Control?
content: üìù **Version Control** is a time machine for your code.
‚Ä¢ **Track Every Change**: See exactly who changed what, when, and why.
‚Ä¢ **Travel Back in Time**: Revert to any previous version if you break something.
‚Ä¢ **Experiment Fearlessly**: Create parallel universes (branches) to test crazy ideas.
‚Ä¢ **Collaborate Sanely**: Work with 100 people on the same file without overwriting each other.

callout.text: Software without version control is like writing an exam with no option to erase. One mistake and your future regrets multiply forever.

slides.title: üìú History of Git
content: ‚Ä¢ Linux kernel development needed a better VCS.
‚Ä¢ Existing options were either too slow or proprietary (BitKeeper).
‚Ä¢ He wrote the first version of Git in just **2 weeks**!
‚Ä¢ Today, it is the standard for software development worldwide.

slides.title: Why Version Control is Non-Negotiable
content: ‚ùå Commenting out code blocks just to 'save' them.
‚ùå emailing zip files to your teammates.
‚ùå "It works on my machine" but breaks on yours.
‚úÖ A clear, linear history of every modification.
‚úÖ Instant rollback to the last working state.
‚úÖ A single source of truth for the entire team.

slides.title: Big Tech Runs on Git
content: Open Source is the engine of modern technology.
**Meta (Facebook)**: React, PyTorch. (They give away their secret sauce).
**Google**: TensorFlow, Kubernetes, Chromium. (They set the global standards).
**Microsoft**: VS Code, TypeScript. (They build the tools we all use).
These companies don't just use Git; they build their empires on it. **93% of developers** rely on Git.

callout.text: Learning Git isn't just a skill. It's entry into the world's largest collaborative engineering culture.

slides.title: Installing Git
content: Git runs on any OS ‚Äî Linux, macOS, Windows.
You aren't installing software. You're installing a **lifestyle upgrade**.

content: First, let's check if Git is already installed on your machine.

slides.title: First-Time Git Configuration
content: Configure Git with your identity. This information will be attached to your commits.

code.content:
# 1. Create Local Repo
mkdir my-project
cd my-project
git init

# 2. Connect to Remote
git remote add origin https://github.com/user/repo.git

# 3. Sync
git push -u origin main

code.title: üåø Branching Strategy
content: Branches are parallel universes for your code.
**Feature Branch**: Where you do your work safely
**Why?** So you can break things without breaking the app for users.

callout.text: Always create a new branch for every new feature or bug fix. Never commit directly to main.

code.content:
# Create and switch to new branch
git checkout -b feature-login

# List all branches
git branch

# Switch back to main
git checkout main

# Delete a branch
git branch -d feature-login
